subject: p13881772
History: Year old woman with DM1, CKD4, p/w fever, UTI, continuing to be febrile through abx. , eval for interval change.
Impression: As compared to, the cardiac silhouette appears slightly increased in size and is accompanied by pulmonary vascular congestion and minimal interstitial edema. A new more confluent opacity in the left lower lobe could reflect atelectasis, aspiration, or developing infectious pneumonia. Small left pleural effusion is also demonstrated.
